translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Phaladāyaka
The Elder Ghosasaññaka’s Birth Story

analyzed: migaluddaḥ pure āsi  araññe vipine aha
translated: “In the past I was a hunter,🔽in the wilderness, in the jungle;
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
with a group of gods in front.
He was teaching the four truths,

original: desentaṁ amataṁ padaṁ;🔽Assosiṁ madhuraṁ dhammaṁ,🔽sikhino lokabandhuno.
analyzed: a matam  assa usim madhuram dhamma  sikhinaḥ loka bandhunaḥ
translated: teaching the deathless state;🔽I heard the sweet Dhamma🔽of the one with the topknot, the world’s protector.
I had confidence in the mind
in the one who was the unequalled teacher;
Having confidence there,
I crossed over the difficult existence.
Thirty-one eons ago,
I attained that perception then;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the perception of sound.
My defilements are burned up,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done what the Buddha asked.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Ghosasaññaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ghosasaññako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Ghosasaññakattherassāpadānaṁ aṭṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā ghosasaññakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽ghosasaññaka therassa apadānam aṭṭhama
translated: The Elder Ghosasaññaka’s Birth Story, the eighth.
